alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued June 18 at 2:48PM PDT until June 19 at 7:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 7 AM PDT MONDAY... ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 8 AM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures of 27 to 32 are expected. For the second Freeze Warning, sub- freezing temperatures of 24 to 32 are expected. * WHERE...For the first Freeze warning, north-central Lake County, including Silver Lake and Fort Rock. For the second Freeze Warning, all valley areas in central and eastern Lake County. This includes Silver Lake, Fort Rock, Paisley, Valley Falls, and Lakeview. * WHEN...For the first Freeze Warning, from 2 AM to 7 AM PDT Monday. For the second Freeze Warning, from 1 AM to 8 AM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
